{"draw":0,"recordsTotal":190,"recordsFiltered":190,"data":[{"id":252,"type":"Fake - Report had falsified evidence","appellant":"76561198253200163 (v_luckY_v)","alts":"No Alternative Accounts | steamname: v_luckY_v | steam3ID: [U:1:292934435] | steamID32: STEAM_0:1:146467217 | steamID64: http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198253200163 | customURL: http://steamcommunity.com/id/lucky813 | steamrep: http://steamrep.com/profiles/76561198253200163","description":"I got scammed by this site (skins-roll.com) and I got banned. So from the start of this incident, I had an AWP Asiimov Battle-Scarred and I was kind of getting bored with it, so I was just searching up about new CSGO jackpot sites, then I found this (which turned out to be a douchebag scam site). I wasn't paying attention to anything except for finding a new site to play around with (got bored with csgobubble coinflip). When I first entered this site, after logging in with Steam, a message popped out, saying that if you add "skins-roll.com" to your name, it gives you 7% extra win rate, and I did exactly that. After that, I went ahead and deposited, thinking that I had a chance to win. At the end, I lost my AWP.However, after I lost (against a bunch of fake bets), I did not take "skins-roll.com" off my Steam name because I was applying for chat moderator on that site (I did not know that it was a scam site until recent times). Then one of the "moderators" contacted me, saying that they would hire me, and the pay was $50 per month (I wanted to earn back what I lost on skins-roll.com). Being an ignorant idiot I was back then, I decided to take the "job" offer without thinking about anything.   I believe that after I accpeted the fake job offer was when people starting finally reporting this site. I also heard some information about skins-roll's legitimacy at the time, but I was, again, being ignorant, and decided to keep the name tag on. About 5 days later, every one of the "moderators" that I added on steam blocked and unfriended me, and that is when I knew I messed up. 2 days later, I got banned.  First of all, before blaming anything else (including the site), I just want to say sorry for being an ignorant person. I was acting like an idiot and did not think about anything being a scam at all. I learned my lesson and will be more careful when I am looking for csgo related sites on the internet.   Now, onto the site part. I have never been a real "admin" on this site. I might have looked like one because when I got to be a "chat moderator", the scammers told me to add different informations on my profile (including advertisements), which I did. However, I have never got control to "control games and pots" and thus never got actual skins.   Attached screenshot is the trade that confirms my deposit on skins-roll.com (I also added it to your file hosting site) If you guys have anything to ask, please do contact me because I am so fustrated by this incident and I want to get rid of it. Sorry for taking your time and thank you for helping me out.","evidence":"https://files.f-o-g.eu/1fgdbe80aa1d150eace014fd75856f2g ","assignee_id":null,"state_id":5,"views":613,"locked":1,"creator_id":513,"modificator_id":513,"created_at":"22.08.2017 06:56:40","updated_at":"2017-09-24 12:20:26","state":"Rejected","assignee":"

"},{"id":292,"type":"Change of Heart","appellant":"76561198127502382 (tyler)","alts":"","description":"Well, i don't know how else to convince you but i guess this is a shot. Yea, i did try scamming back then, i was pretty new to the csgo scene and i was broke in real life, my friend told me that u could just imposter people, i thought that was a way to go for the csgo pin scene back when it was active. I was greedy, didn't really care at that time how others would feel if i did end up scamming, but i never ended up scamming anyone when i was impostering that dude, was just a fool trying to make some money and then realized how much of an idiot he was. At the age of 12 I used to twitch stream, and I got a good amount a money from a friend through a donation (like 25-40$). With this money I was going to buy a AK skin off the market, but my friend stopped me. He told me he had bought skins directly from people, and that you could get much better deals. I took his advice, and sought after a good skin. When I finally saw someone that had one I wanted, I contacted them through steam. I had heard of people getting scammed, so when she told me to go first I was worried. So what I did was look up the username on Google as so. "Is (username) a scammer?" I know this was stupid, but at the time it was completely plausible in my mind. I did not find much, so I assumed I was in the clear. I went into my paypal. Here is where I messed up. Unlike the mobile version, to an unintelligent 11 year old, the desktop site is not simple. I was lost and did not know how to send money. I was clicking buttons and hyperlinks all over the page, until I landed on a page that said "Send Invoice". I assumed this was where I had to be (not knowing what an invoice was) because I saw a place to type in the amount of money to send, as well as an email. After sending what I thought was $20, I told her that I had sent it. I got no response. I thought I got scammed. Skipping forward to know, I was going to send one of my PUBG skins to an IRL friend. We had closed the deal, for cash at school the next day. He came back telling me that he could not trust me because I was banned on steamrep.com. I was shocked, for a while I did not even know why even after seeing the reason. Thank you for reading this, and hope you guys understand. For what happened, I had used a CSGODouble (if you remember, it was a gambling site) script that would take peoples coins if they copied it into the html console. I did this because it happened to me so I got mad. I will say again like I did in my last appeal, I never made any money off of this. My appeal was denied because there was no way to prove it. In this appeal I will try to prove that I did not make any money from this. Of course, the pastebin link to the script was taken down when I submitted my first appeal, so that hasn't been an issue. Also the site is down so I couldn't use it anyway. I should state that I think I should be unbanned because this is the ONLY time I have ever tried something malicious to make money. I have never tried to scam anyone besides from this, and never will. My proof is in my trade/market history on steam. First, I will show my trade history. Keep in mind this website was deposit/trade SKINS ONLY. There was no way for me to get paypal/bitcoin money, etc. This scam attempt happened on April 19, 2016. In my trade history, you can see that there are no trades at all on April 19, with the closest trades being April 15 and April 22. You can also see that I am actually depositing my own skins, not withdrawing other skins. I will also post the entire next page to show that I am constantly "trading" with the website, withdrawing items of equal value to what I deposit. Next I will show my market history. Market history doesn't show year, but I started at the end (or start technically) since my account was made in September 2015, and went to April of the next year. You can see that there is also nothing on April 19, with the closest ones being April 17 and April 22. This is as close as I can get to proving that I didn't get anything out of this. I know this is 2 years later, and I also don't really trade anymore since CS:GO trading is kind of dead, but I just really don't like having a SteamRep ban for something that didn't even give me anything.
